message: And I quote: """"If modern medicine didnâ€t have symptoms they wouldnâ€t have a reason to â€œpracticeâ€ medicine. For medicine is primarily symptomology."""" Amen to that! The assumption and current scientific paradigm is that the human body functions as machines function, so modern medicine works in the same way mechanics work on a broken car. But, more and more, we are now finding out our bodies are more like depositories of millions and millions of ecosystems, individual, interdependent, complex and unknown. More shocking; the ancient traditional foods and medicines that have been passed down, generation after generation, seem to be much more beneficial to us than all our modern mumbo jumbo.
Lucy Cleary-Smith
And I'm not a Hillary supporter, just common sense.

I am convinced that the Clintons look out across this land of ours and insofar as they are concerned they see nothing other than what they think are rubes, rednecks and buffoons that they can lie to, cheat and con. I suspect they privately laugh to themselves about how easily people are fooled and I suspect that even the Clintons are surprised about what they have gotten by with.
